comment.author: 7776496@N03
comment._content: A lot of homemade flair to this private's coat. Later on, all that trim would disappear

comment.author: 14775694@N04
comment._content: This man could be a Confederate Officer. Although this soldier might appear a bit too young and mostly Confederate, those black patches on his shoulders could be that of a Union-style officer rank insignia. It did not occur often, but some of the Confederate officers did wear the Union-style rank insignia on their shoulders. Such as General Wade Hampton: www.sonofthesouth.net/leefoundation/Hampton/general-wade-...
